00040 // Includes

00043 #include "..\MainLoop\CProcess.h"
00044 
00045 // Miles sound library has some level 4 warnings
00046 //#pragma warning( push, 3 )

00050 #include "CAudio.h"
00051 #include "CSoundResource.h"
00052 
00054 // CSoundProcess Description
00055 //
00056 //    A Sound Process, not to be confused with a Sound Resource (CSoundResource)
00057 //        manages a sound as it is being played. You can use this class to manage
00058 //    timing between sounds & animations.
00059 //
00061 
00062 class CSoundProcess : public CProcess  
00063 {
00064 public:
00065         CSoundProcess(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> soundResource, int typeOfSound=PROC_SOUNDFX, int volume=100, bool looping=false);
00066         
00067         virtual ~CSoundProcess();
00068 
00069         virtual void    OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds);
00070         virtual void    OnInitialize();
00071         virtual void    Kill();
00072 
00073         virtual void    TogglePause();
00074 
00075         void Play(const int volume, const bool looping);
00076         void Stop();
00077 
00078         void                    SetVolume(int volume);
00079         int                             GetVolume();
00080         int                             GetLengthMilli();
00081         bool                    IsSoundValid() { return m_SoundResource!=NULL; }
00082         bool                    IsPlaying();
00083         bool                    IsLooping() { return m_AudioBuffer && m_AudioBuffer->VIsLooping(); }
00084         float                   GetProgress();
00085         
00086 protected:
00087         CSoundProcess();        //Disable Default Construction
00088 
00089         void                    InitializeVolume();
00090         void                    Replay() { m_bInitialUpdate = true; };
00091 
00092         
00093         shared_ptr<CSoundResource> m_SoundResource;             // this is the raw sound data
00094         shared_ptr<IAudioBuffer> m_AudioBuffer;                 //handle to the implementation dependant audio buffer (DSound, Miles) 
00095 
00096         int                             m_Volume;                                               // these hold the initial setting until the sound is actually launched.
00097         bool                    m_isLooping;
00098 };
00099

00103 // CExplosionProcess Description
00104 //
00105 // This is an example of a process that uses a simple state machine
00106 // to control itself. 
00107 //
00109 
00110 class CExplosionProcess : public CProcess
00111 {
00112   public:
00113         CExplosionProcess() : CProcess(PROC_GAMESPECIFIC) { m_Stage=0; }
00114    
00115   protected:
00116         int m_Stage;
00117         shared_ptr<CSoundProcess> m_Sound;
00118    
00119         virtual void    OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds);
00120         virtual void    OnInitialize();
00121 };
00122 
00124 // CFadeProcess Description
00125 //
00126 // Fades sound volume in or out over time and then kills itself.
00127 // This should be useful for groups of sound effects, too - such as when
00128 //   an AI barks and it must be heard above the other effects like too much freaking thunder.
00129 //
00131 
00132 class CFadeProcess : public CProcess
00133 {
00134 
00135 protected:
00136         shared_ptr<CSoundProcess> m_Sound;
00137         
00138         int m_TotalFadeTime;
00139         int m_ElapsedTime;
00140         int m_StartVolume;
00141         int m_EndVolume;
00142 public:
00143         CFadeProcess(shared_ptr<CSoundProcess> sound, int fadeTime, int endVolume);
00144         virtual void    OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds);  
00145 };
